website_summaries.verdict: Designed for decorative pruning work, these shears come from one of the top names in the yard tool business.
pros: The steel blades swivel for easy access to plants, and they are long enough to hold the greenery straight while it is being cut
Blades lock when not in use
Product comes with a lifetime warranty
cons: Patience is needed, as these shears are not designed for heavy-duty work or cutting in bulk

customer_reviews.title: Mine has held up well for more than a few years.  This works better than any power trimmer I have tried
customer_reviews.text: I keep going back to this tool, after trying the various power trimmers (string or plastic blade) on the market. With string I spent more time messing with the string than it would take me to do all of my edging with this scissor tool. With the plastic blade one I tried, a lot of the grass was bent over by the tool, but not actually cut. This tool has remained sharp enough to cut. I did have to use fine metal sand paper after allowing the blades to rust, but that restored it to good working condition.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Keeney

customer_reviews.title: They work great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I really like these Fiskars long handled swivel grass shears. I've been searching for a way to cut the long grass that grows along our fence when I came across these and decided to give them a try. They are easy to use and my hand does not get tired after using them for a while. I do recommend wearing gloves when using these because the skin on my fingers started to be sore from friction after using them a while. Now I wear gloves and my skin doesn't bother me anymore. Check out my before and after photos of the grass I trimmed with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lewis

customer_reviews.title: I like this concept
customer_reviews.text: I like this concept. Never did care much for electric or gas weed eaters except maybe in large areas. For my little yard in the burbs this works out well especially because this old man is finding it harder and harder to bend down. I would have given it 5 stars but I find it to be slightly flimsy (but just slightly). When I try to cut a bunch of grass close to the ground it will not do it . Whereas the sturdy, bend down hand clippers I own will. If I ever need to buy another I will know to look for something with a bit more strength to it. All things considered though it's a good buy
customer_reviews.author: Varnan

customer_reviews.title: Oil did the trick
customer_reviews.text: I own many Fiskars tools, so I expected this one to be of high-quality and of ergonomic design. When I started using it, I found the mechanism was sticky, causing me to have to manually open the blades after each clip. Very tedious! I coated the spring mechanism inside the pole handle with 3-in-1 oil, and let it sit for a day. This morning when I used the tool again, the clipping action was smooth and efficient. I expect to use this tool for many years ahead. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to squeeze and head rotates for ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Can you use it soley to weed-eat? Depends on how patient you are. Did the edging perfectly for a 30'x40' yard but nicer than a weedeater would have. Peaceful/precise and kind of fun. Like scissors on a stick. No complaints after 1 hour of use. Better than dragging a cord around and wearing goggles like with the weedeater.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Shear blades are too short
customer_reviews.text: I will keep this review short - the blade length is way too short. I have another pair from a different company, and they are about 2 inches longer than these. I get so frustrated using these because they are not long enough nor open wide enough to grab and cut a sufficient amount of edging. Therefore I have to cut, move up, cut, move forward cut, move down, cut. Not good and would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp, too small.
customer_reviews.text: Didnt work for me. They don't open extremely wide, they don't seem to be very sharp. I can see how these would be worth using on the edge of something delicate that you dont want to damage with a weedeater, but I have some wild garden area that I like to trim the grass between flowers, this only works for a tiny amount at a time and doesnt cut well enough. It would probably have been faster and easier with clippers on my hands and knees.... for the price I expected something that cuts better! I cant believe people use these along an entire fence line!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, quiet, and easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: The grass shears are great for cutting in sensitive areas. Unlike powered string trimmers, it does not spray clippings onto ponds and swimming pools. It does not disturb neighbors. And, it allows you to cut close to trees and shrubs without risking stripping the bark, etc. The shears have a rocker lever that locks the blades closed. I recommend locking the blades closed when walking between cutting sites to avoid accidental injury. Remember that these are grass shears. Briars and woody plants are not ideal. However, the shears do well on pompass grass (one or two blades at a time). This tool will get a lot of use in our yard.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase for me.
customer_reviews.text: These clippers have not worked right since the day I received them. The handle sticks closed every time you press it. I tried everything to get them to work correctly and finally just gave up. It's a pain to have to pull the handle open each time so the clippers will open up. I'm not sure if it's the clippers that are sticking closed whenever the handle is pressed together or if it's the handle sticking in a closed position. Either way, these clippers are awful.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: I gave it one star but it deserves zero
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why any able-bodied person would want this clipper. The blades do not open very wide and you can only cut about 2 inches at a time. I would have returned to Amazon but the return window had closed. Complete waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: BHNY

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this one!
customer_reviews.text: This is for the patient gardener who enjoy gardening and who is really in to details with their garden. Is a very nice tool, dont expect the quick sloppy result of a weed wacker or edger, this tool is for more slow precision and dedication. It works excellent for me, all the base, handle and holder is plastic so you need to treat it nicely other wise you will be another of the bad reviews. The convenience of not having to bend is where I think is worth paying 35 dollars, because I'm not sure all this plastic will last. It swivels so those uncomfortable areas are less complicated now.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Neris

customer_reviews.title: Flimsiest Construction - Broke Within First Five Minutes
customer_reviews.text: Don't recommend this purchase at all. I bought this item to cut some wild grass in my backyard. Within five minutes of the operation (I mean literally - I could not have used this for more than five minutes), one of the blades started to angle in a manner that made it impossible for the trimmer to close and trim anymore. I have to look for an alternative but save your time and money by skipping this poorly made/designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Tertain

customer_reviews.title: It's Just OK
customer_reviews.text: It works OK for light trimming to avoid taking out the stringer trimmer Perfect length and decent cutting I gave it only 3 stars due to the poor handle design. When the handle is squeezed, the top of the lever pinches the index finger. If I hold my hand away, it still manages to get me. The squeeze handle is not comfortable even when not pinching me I'm keeping it as it serves me well for very light duty service. If you use this less than 5 minutes each time and don't mind the comfort issue, then I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Frank M.

customer_reviews.title: Useful for deadheading flowers in window boxes.
customer_reviews.text: These appear as if they will do the job. The job in this case is trimming flowers in planters hanging from a second floor window. This is a wide window with glass panels that open outward like a door from the center post, which means it's impossible to deadhead blooms without a ladder or hanging out like a circus performer. These shears will allow me to reach the far ends of the planters and not just the center plants. I wish the shears would also rotate downwards like a ballerina pointing her toes, but I'm sure I'll find a way to deal with the problem over time. No more trying to reach over from the center or from a ladder!
customer_reviews.author: Northwoods

customer_reviews.title: I really like how the blades can be safely locked shut when ...
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for 3 years and it works well in the places my lawn mower won't reach. We got this because we just wanted something simple and not a motorized weed whacker. It serves our purpose well, still sharp and no rusting (yet). I really like how the blades can be safely locked shut when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving these shears. I bought them because my husband had a motorcycle accident, crushed his ankle, and will be on crutches for a few months. He usually does the lawn work, so it was looking pretty ratty. I can use the lawn mower, but not the weed eater. With this thing, I can trim around the house and plants where the mower doesn’t go. You can use either hand, so when both get tired, I stop. I have a bad back, so not having to bend over to use this is great. I also love that the blades can turn sideways, so it does a great job of edging.
customer_reviews.author: D. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, terrible execution
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomic is a joke. The whole idea is for elderly who can't stoop over to cut the occasional wayward weed. The concept of not leaning over and being able to clip weeds either vertical or horizontally is great. The actual cutting gives little or no leverage, so cutting something with substance is hard on the arthritic hand. Ergonomic is fiction. The lock is hard to engage, the handle is hard and has sharp edges. I am keeping since my needs are minor and occasional, so i am going to try to pad wrap the handle to make it work. Pretty cheap product for the money. Two stars is the plus for concept. That may be a stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Middle Road

customer_reviews.title: They're Fiskars, the best made.
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a Fiskar tool that wasn't the best quality and function. They even replaced a 10 year old pole saw/trimmer several years ago when it quit functioning. I gave these 4 stars because for trimming long borders, they get caught on small twigs etc. that have to be manually removed. Maybe that's my fault but it wouldn't keep me from buying again for incidental trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Kidder

customer_reviews.title: This garden tool gets a thumbs up !  👍
customer_reviews.text: As someone who doesn’t like using weed eaters for a variety of reasons, I was looking for a way to do my trimming without having to drag around cords or change spools. When I came across this tool, I had to give it a try and I’m so glad I did. This is a very nice and handy garden tool. It’s lightweight but sturdy. The blades are sharp, it cuts beautifully, the ease of changing the variety of different angles offered is exceptional and it is an all around plus to my gardening and lawn caring needs. I have a decent size yard and was able to do all the necessary trimming without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskandreamer

customer_reviews.title: Great invention, saves your back
customer_reviews.text: Read all kinds of horror stories about this... I love it. I trim my pond daily with it and it is great for reaching into the pond and trimming around the sides without stooping over. Have used it daily for 5 weeks and it is just as good as the day I got it. I oil it periodically.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Saves my back
customer_reviews.text: I love these clippers because now I can cut the pesky crab grass and dandelions that grow between the gaps in a concrete patio. It saves me the back ache I would have got from having to stoop over to cut them. I'm also saved from knee aches from having to get down on the hard concrete ground to cut back the grass with hand shears. The blade section on this tool twists so you can move the blades to the right or the left to get just the angle you want. I use this feature when I cut back grass and weeds from a rock wall. I'm very happy with this tool and glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Seven Stars

customer_reviews.title: bcoz the other products I have from Friskars have been great. (Push mower
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made product. I have St. Augustin grass and this edger struggles to cut with ease. After 3 or 4 times of use the blades ceased cross over. Very cheaply made, which I am surprised, bcoz the other products I have from Friskars have been great. (Push mower, Shears and tree pruner) Unfortunately I have discarded the box it came in and couldn't return it on time. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: RoxyMomof3

customer_reviews.title: Small cutting area
customer_reviews.text: These are light and easy to use one handed but I disagree with another review that they will not cause fatigue - they do if you have a large area to cut especially with the limited spread of the blades - a lot more work. And they won't cut much in each "bite" either. Put too much grass or weeds etc in the blades and it won't cut either, it chokes up. So cheap but not very effective if you have a lot to do
customer_reviews.author: Pipster

customer_reviews.title: Too small to be of any use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get something that would trim the grass around my trees and a pole in my yard that my lawn mower misses. The shear blades are just too short. It takes FOREVER to trim a small amount of grass snipping an area about 3 inches wide at a time. Just not a good purchase and I am regretting buying them. Seemed like a good idea at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Paul

customer_reviews.title: flimsy - unlikely to last long
customer_reviews.text: this clipper is just ok for the price. it is not well made and I do not think it will last long. the key parts for sturdiness are made from brittle, weak plastic. the blades cut grass ok but that is about it. anything thicker (like some weeds) and the blades jam. I'm surprised Fiskars would put their name on it - it is not up to their usual quality standards.
customer_reviews.author: Bob K

customer_reviews.title: Works ...if you're not in a rush...
customer_reviews.text: Hits: inexpensive and works as advertised. Misses: In my non expert, grass clipper opinion, these things feel flimsy to me. Doesn't take much to " clog" or get the blades stuck together. If you're patient and only want to clip a few blades of grass at a time you may find this product suitable. The overall idea is great, but needs improvement. Longer handle for thoes of us that are not lilliputian in size and more robust spring and cutter power would be a start. As mentioned, taking fairly moderate size bites chokes this thing like a snake swallowing a baseball.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent except for shipping box condition
customer_reviews.text: This works well. Very pleased with purchase. The blades have several different angle positions. The blades seem a little longer than usual, which makes it more stable than my other shears. The handle grip also makes it very stable. Being able to lock the blades is a really good thing. However the packaging was poor...it arrived with both blades separated and sticking out on the outside of the box. Needs better padding for shipping. Please look into this, someone could get a serious cut. I am a regular customer, not a paid reviewer.
customer_reviews.author: ED JR

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I can find little good to say about this product. The blade length is quite short so you are unable to cut more than about a 4” section of grass. The shear only opens about 2” wide at the tip of the blades so you are unable to get very much grass in each cut. Due to the above two issues you also miss quite a bit of grass in the area you are cutting. I like most Fiskars products, but this is not one of them. Also, the box that Amazon shipped this in was so oversized it would have been very difficult to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy S

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a while.... Then cheap chinese metal rod inside breaks. The blades no longer work. Pity because the design was useful. A better steel rod would not have broken.
customer_reviews.author: George W. Demott

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Fiskars grass shears to replace an electric weed trimmer. The weed trimmer was heavy, awkward to move about the yard with due to the electric cord and the cord kept disconnecting from the handle. The Fiskars grass shears are lightweight, work very effectively and I don't have to drag a heavy cord around. They clip all types of grass and thin stemmed vegetation. You don't get the even trim of an electric trimmer but the advantages far outweigh the negatives and with a little care and patience you can get a very nice result.
customer_reviews.author: Romany Rose

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should but...
customer_reviews.text: It’s only able to cut grass and weeds. Maybe that’s all it’s designed to do. No small branches though. That would have been nice as I have a rose bed and it’s a but too much for this clipper. Good idea though. Update: better be patient as it’s slow going trimming with this trimmer. It would be faster if I just sat on the ground and used my hand trimmer or even my Fisker scissors. Unwieldy., but it does cut the grass. It’s clip clip, move forward clip clip etc.
customer_reviews.author: WyogalTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a good idea, but....
customer_reviews.text: When watching the video and reading about how easy this would be to trim my lawn without bending down, I thought it was worth a try. It is very flimsy; the blade has already bended. It also does not cut smoothly or easily, so it is very slow going. I am back to using my electric edger except for edge between the lawn and bender board where the edger doesn't work. Wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basically scissors on a stick
customer_reviews.text: These work reasonably well as an edge trimmer but can require adjustment over and over to get the angle right. It’s effectively a pair of scissors at the end of a stick, so if that’s what you need great. It’s an eco-friendly alternative to gas/electric trimmer but you won’t want to use for more than 20 minutes before getting hand cramps.
customer_reviews.author: zeroorone

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this tool.
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this tool, but am, as I type, looking for the next step up to a battery operated version. Why? I don't have a lawn. I have a small patch of "patio" that is keystone and faux keystone squares and pieces with zoysia grass planted to fill in the spaces. The area measures roughly 8'x8'. My eye-hand coordination is good. The cutting edges are nice and sharp and they do cut very well, but I find that it takes far too long and far too many snips to get the area trimmed. I think I should have started with the battery B&D Weed Wacker, for about $20 more, which I am about to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GZA

customer_reviews.title: Nice for trimming dead stems without bending over
customer_reviews.text: These shears work exactly as you would expect, although the blades seem to jam somewhat easily. They're handy for cutting a few isolated stems, but the manual nature of the shears make any serious trimming a big pain.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A

customer_reviews.title: Only for light jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED the Fiskars reel mower. The mower is an absolute delight to use. I don't have a very big yard (front is 50 ft X 30 ft. rear/side is 20 ft by 40 in various rectangles.) So, for edging I thought I would stick with the noiseless manual solution and try this 36-in shears. Silly me. While I can get an *ok* job, it is too slow for this purpose. It will do around a flower bed easily, but using it as an edger is not its purpose. They do cut well and they are lightweight. SO, if you are using a weedeater to edge your lawn, I don't see the need for these shears.
customer_reviews.author: Atheist1696

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are trying to trim thin grass , these are not helpful at all . The smallest stick , stem , or piece of mulch will keep the blades from doing their thing . Thick or bushy grass is too much for these. They do save your back and are easy to use if and only if you’re trimming tall thin grass. Will give away, or keep just to do the little areas they are capable of doing, but wouldn’t buy or recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: KRB61

customer_reviews.title: Only for the lightest work
customer_reviews.text: These are a FAIL They work great on “A BLADE of Regular grass Anything more than that and you start to run into problems Basically it can’t get the job done as intended unless you have tons of patients and only cut a couple blades of grass at a time(ie playing around) Great concept But the spring loaded blades separate not allowing the scissors Action Won’t do well for efficient yardwork
customer_reviews.author: lonewolf

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I should have taken the before and after photos, but forgot. I had overgrown ornamental grass and lily leaves flowing onto the brick pathway to the backyard. It was very easy to cut back and contain it within the area. Also the swivel function was very handy while trimming the grass between the fence and vegetable patches. Only reason for removing one star from ergonomic is, perhaps it could be that I over did, but I had wrist pain for the next few days. So a simple suggestion from my side not to over do.
customer_reviews.author: amazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Saves your back, but
customer_reviews.text: It does save your back and knees from all that bending. Takes some getting use to due in part to the forward angle of the shaft and mostly for the grips, which would be more comfortable if they were designed horizontally instead of vertically like typical shears. In other words, by repositioning the grips by 90 degrees, one's wrist would not be fully bent downward but kept in a stable and more natural position.
customer_reviews.author: kazekozo77

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my string trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I use these on a small lawn for everything that I previously used a string trimmer for. Yes, it takes longer. Yes, your hands can get tired. They won't cut hard things in the path of your trim ( such as wood chips around garden beds), BUT for cutting the grass up close to edges, around trees, etc they work great. So nice and quiet to use them, they help make lawn care a peaceful activity.
customer_reviews.author: JNewmm

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly what I had hoped for. The blades are sharp and cut cleanly, the long handle makes it easy to reach the weeds. I use this trimmer to control weeds rather than have the harmful chemicals sprayed around my trailer. As long as I keep the house neat and free of weeds, no chemicals. This was the tool I needed. It's easy to store and clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jes11

customer_reviews.title: Trimming without the cord
customer_reviews.text: The Fiskars grass trimmer works great. I'll admit that a string trimmer is better, but the hand trimmer is ready to go instead of dragging out cords, charging batteries or tuning up. You also dont have to stop to replace the broken line. It is a little tiring on the hand if you are not used to that kind of movement,but all in all it is great for quick trimming if you stay on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Raybee

customer_reviews.title: Snip and clip
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent clipper for anyone who has trouble bending over. Would be much better with a set of wheels on the back for even better maneuverability. Do not use excessively or you will get hand cramping and some carpal tunnel issues.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: So worth the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a problem with bending over. Fiskars makes a great product to begin with. This is no exception. Same quality garden tool but with long handle. I thought the handle would make the tool lose some performance when used, but it absolutely does not. Using it was smooth and very easy. I have arthritis and I enjoyed doing the trim around the house. Much easier to hang onto than a weed whacker or power trimmer. No string to worry about, no noise except a bit a snip snip and very high quality material, so being able to lean on it to rest was a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Just an ok product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the handle after I used the shears - wanted to stand & trim grass in corners. It just did ok. Did not cut grass like the shears. I had to struggle for some time and then finally went back to the shears. Now, this is sleeping in my garage :)
customer_reviews.author: rams

customer_reviews.title: ONE use and they crossed over and locked up
customer_reviews.text: literally 3 seconds of use and the blades crossed over and locked up. A HUGE waste of time waiting for these toarrive, complete junk. Returned them and drove to Lowes. DONT WASTE YOUR CASH
customer_reviews.author: michelle~

customer_reviews.title: I was happy to find that this shear would cut them down ...
customer_reviews.text: I hd been having a problem with Bamboo coming fron the neighbors yard into mine for over 20 Years, I had been bending over to cut new ones that were coming up ( 40 to 80 ) per Day in the spring and summer Months which really worked on my back. I was happy to find that this shear would cut them down to the ground when they were tender to 3/4" round in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Paradis

customer_reviews.title: Handle is short if you are tall.
customer_reviews.text: Overall not bad. Hard for a tall person. Shears work better when canted one way. It takes a little experimentation to get it right for edging. Smaller cut than I would have liked. Does not easily or cleanly cut the gifts of grass that grow under obstacles where the mower won’t reach.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Janner

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars... PLEASE make a tall version about ...
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars...PLEASE make a tall version about a foot longer. I am almost 6' and i had to stoop. Did a decent job though. If i had quit at about 20 mins. I would not have gotten a backache. Also could use softer comfort grip for both hands. Somewhat awkward to use, but that will probably ease each use. Overall, it makes what was an impossible task possible. Tip...wear glasses with a 5-6' distance, such as type you wear for TV...that makes it easier to see what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: IslandReader

customer_reviews.title: Saves your back from cutting grass!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the hand grass shears version back in November and loved it, however my back started to get stiff so I decided to purchase the long handle grass shears. The long handle grass shear is made of plastic body and steel for the shears which makes it light weight. I love this product, except that I feel the scissor portion does not open wide enough. I feel like I cut less grass compared to the normal hand grass shears. I mainly use the long handle sears to cut around sprinklers, and the edging where my lawn mower missed a spot.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie and Viet

customer_reviews.title: They Work!
customer_reviews.text: I love my garden, but due to old age and arthritis cannot bend to trim around my plant. This works great. It is sharp and lever is easy to squeeze. It is not as heavy as an electric trimmer with a battery pack. I am short, so it would be nice if the length of the handle could be adjusted as it is a little log for me, however, I would recommend this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: jas

customer_reviews.title: Remember it is not a weed wacker
customer_reviews.text: You have to remember that it is not a motorized weed wacker, it is hand operated. It will take time but they work pretty good will not cut your hedges if material is to think and linkage may bind if you try. However for small applications they are very ample, easy to use and I would say constructed for all sizes of people I am 6'2" and do do not need to been over to much except to see where I am cutting, just plan on taking some time to trim and you will be satisfied with the results
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with my Fiska trimmer shears!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an older apartment complex that hasn't got enough grass to mow every week...except behind MY apartment. Its the grass, weed actually, that has tall pinwheels, which grows very quickly. These shears are perfect to keep those pinwheels cut down so I don't lose my Dixie in the grass. Tall grass and short legs aren't a good combination. They are also perfect to trim the grass around my plants that the lawn guys can't seem to get to.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: You need a lot of patience using this.
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as described. I love Fiskars products, I own many of them. I purchased this so I could get the long grass around my landscaping blocks without killing the toads and frogs with my gas weed eater. You must have a lot of patience with this, as it will only cut small portions at a time. The mouth of the scissors does not open very wide so it's a slow process. Otherwise it works fine and I feel it's well built like the rest of their tools. It just has a small mouth which makes the task painfully slow.
customer_reviews.author: ginger

customer_reviews.title: No need to bend down to cut weeds with these long handled sharp scissors
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting dandelions. I use a weedeater, but sometimes just a few more dandelions crop up and this works to not have to weed eat right away again. Just use it a little at a time so you don't hurt your back if you have back troubles.Works well to trim other taller types of weeds that crop up around yard. Nice sharp scissors at bottom of long handle. Use work gloves to not hurt hand, too, when squeezing handle at top.
customer_reviews.author: Mixher

customer_reviews.title: Love these things
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them much, but I think this will eliminate the need for a powered weed eater. My yard is small without lots of things to trim except the fence line, a few trees, and the border of the house. These seem to work great. Excellent complement to my Fiskar's reel mower. Noiseless lawn care. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: DIYTechFan

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy for Fiskars
customer_reviews.text: This isn't as strong as a usual pair of grass shears. Nor even a pair of Fiskars scissors. This is useful only for its long handle, & can trim only in very small clumps. The flexible angle and reach is nicely designed, but just isn't as strong as my old regular grass shears or even the new ones. But aren't all newer items are just less sturdy than their predecessors?
customer_reviews.author: Irish Lass

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy if you have a back injury.
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy, couldn't use. A tool like this is needed if a back injury makes bending impossible. But a back injury makes holding/using this tool too painful to use. However- Well made tool. The blades really seem sharp and set together well, so cutting seemed like it would be very effective. The two halves of the handle are a good distance apart--not so wide that it's hard to get your hand around both at once, like some other clipping tools.
customer_reviews.author: turtle

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Build -- Buy a better version.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic gears? Thin weak blades that clog too easily? Swivel feature notches to hold position that wore out almost immediately! Great concept, but lousy construction.
customer_reviews.author: biggestbamboo

customer_reviews.title: My favorite garden tool
customer_reviews.text: I hate to use the weed whacker because it makes such a mess and is loud. The long-handled sheers are quiet and let me get to all the edges without too much mess. I had another pair that rusted and finally broke, hoping these remain rust free. I recommend cleaning and making sure they are dry before putting them away.
customer_reviews.author: Liisb Mass

customer_reviews.title: Long handle grass shear cutter
customer_reviews.text: I am an older person with arthritis but still like working with flowers. I like using this shear to trim grass away from around my pots and any other places that I do not want a weed eater. I do not use for long areas or long periods of time. It is for grass only and serves my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Very good clippers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to trim garden bed edges and they do a very good job. The head rotation has more angles then I would ever use, they are light and fairly well balanced. The quality is typical Fiskar well beyond the price point and its nice to be able to trim without bending over all the time. If I was to change anything I would increase the lie a few degrees and increase the shear opening. I would certainly purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Useful in conjunction with a reel mower to maintain your lawn.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tool if you don't want to use powered equipment anymore on your lawn. Will clean up grass/weeds near fire hydrants and polls that typically are taken down with a weed wacker. If you use a reel mower, it will cut dandelions that the mower sometimes misses.
customer_reviews.author: SonnyK

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.text: This came in a timely manner, however I'm not sure why it was sent separately from the Grampa's weeder I ordered at the same time. It was sent from same Amazon location, but for some reason it arrived a day later the Fishers 36 inch Long-handl Swivel Grass Shears work better than I expected. The blades are sharp and cut well and the manual handles at the top are easy to use, requiring slightly more pressure than normal grass shears. I have back and knee issues and these are a blessing in that they save me from bending or getting down on the ground to trim. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: but it looks like it's been used or returned
customer_reviews.text: I always expect that the product I buy from Amazon are brand new quality products. I bought this Fiskars 36 in. grass cuttes because I cannot bend my kneeswhen weeding. I received the product as promised, but it looks like it's been used or returned. There were scratches on the handle. The scissor looks like it was cleaned. The safety lock is difficult to open and close. I still want this product so I am going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: dorre

customer_reviews.title: Great except for the handle
customer_reviews.text: If you garden, you need one. With typical Fiskars sharpness, and a surprisingly good action, you can cut through woody things just smaller than a pencil without too much difficulty. In terms of precision weeding, it can't be beat. The handle, however, features a squared off corner right where your index finger pulls against it. I have hands like leather, and it only barely bothers me, but, really, its poor design and should be fixed by the design engineers. I'll probably take a file to it at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to get the trimmer to trim grass by the curbs and edging etc and it worked for about 2 weeks then the spring that controls the blades broke and therefore it can't be used. Not sure if we just got a lemon or if Fiskars quality has gone down this much.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: the ease of using this is priceless.
customer_reviews.text: I am a 70 year old woman. I got this today and tried it out. OMG, how did I ever live without it. No more bending to edge weeds, no more heavy edger to use. This lightweight, well made shears is going to save my back. I recommend it HIGHLY. And at a low price, so worth every dime.
customer_reviews.author: mona

customer_reviews.title: I don't have to bend over anymore!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and thought out tool. I would recommend this to anyone who can't bend over all the time to trims grass or weeds in your flower beds or gardens. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: So far they are great!
customer_reviews.text: So far the product is cutting great. Last year I bought the hand clippers they locked up constantly so I taped the locking device in place. This year they would not cut anything. So I took a chance and ordered these and so far they are good. I like not having to bend over or be on my knees to use the cutters. I hope they continue to cut well!
customer_reviews.author: Beverley McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Failure Analysis
customer_reviews.text: Disassembled unit today before putting it in the trash bin, metal actuating rod that is closest to the shears broke about 1/2 inch from the end. Suspect a failure in the actual steel when it was produced, since it was plenty think enough to handle the job. Replaced it today with the same item from a brick and mortar hardware store nearby and keeping the receipt and guarantee (lifetime)...not a lot of choices for this type of tool...
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t really work well
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t really work well at all, I figured I would be able to cut down the tall weeds in between my flowers but it is awkward
customer_reviews.author: Ising4joy

customer_reviews.title: Love these grass clippers.
customer_reviews.text: I have long wished for clippers that I didn't have to bend over to use. As I get older, my arthritis gets worse, and it is more and more difficult to do yard work. These grass clippers are the perfect answer to my problem. They are easy to use while standing, and the blades are sharp and work great. I'm extremely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a large area to clip around as I have a small yard, so this tool works great for me! I hated dealing with the string and charging of the weed whippers that seem to lose battery strength over time, so now I don't have to deal with that anymore. Good tool for small yards!
customer_reviews.author: Erin J. Bates

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were sharper and had a wheel
customer_reviews.text: Wish these were sharper - they do not stand up to our edging and tall grass. A wheel at the back would be great for usability so that you do not have to hoist them off of the ground to use them. Would not recommend unless your trimming needs are very, very minor.
customer_reviews.author: Karen-Anne J

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars is the best
customer_reviews.text: This weed clipper is everything I expected it to be. I would highly recommend it to anyone who needs to trim/clip weeds without kneeling or bending over. A great product that works extremely well. I have other Fiskar products; it is an excellent company.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: OK but not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Works OK but not as well as I expected given the Fiskars' reputation. The swivel head is neat except for the fact that it doesn't lock into any given position so it tends to rotate all by itself while using which requires frequent stopping to straighten it out. Also, It doesn't cut very well if the weed is the thickness of a soda straw.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive yard tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Fiskars 36 Inch Long-handle Swivel Grass Shears and one of the handiest tools I have. The first can still be used but the spring no longer releases to open the handle and it got too tiring to manually open it. My side yard is wooded and planted in shade plants so it is most convenient to cut the weeds with this handy tool than to mow. If anything happens to this one, you can bet I'll buy another.
customer_reviews.author: AnnFitz

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: I usually love Fiskars products, but this one needs work. The opening for the scissor blades is not as wide as most scissors, which makes it difficult to cut the grass along the edge of the lawn. You end up making lots of small cuts to achieve the same thing you could using an electric/gas/battery powered edger. It's difficult to maneuver and more often than not, I end up pulling out the grass instead of cutting it. I was hoping to use this instead of my regular edger, but it's less of a hassle to use my battery operated edger.
customer_reviews.author: obieo

customer_reviews.title: Great grass scissors
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I have a small space for my plants, and the lawn mower is too big to go there. So I bought this scissors. The minute they came I started using them. I like them a lot! Thank you for making them!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Tomoyasu

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: It fails to cut most grass unless it is short and well trimmed previously. I got this to trim around apple trees and blueberry bushes - it does neither successfully. I end up pulling the grass out because it is caught between the blades and then having to stop and pull it out from between the blades so that I can start again. I consider this a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Stubbings

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart within 2 months. My first set worked fine for 10 years, one day could no longer change head position so got a new one. Worked ok for about 6 weeks then the head fell off. My husband put it back together but cuts poorly. Will not get another. Best part was being able to squeeze the handle for the cutting action of the shears but the new one I just bought could o my handle a small amount of grass compared to the older one I had
customer_reviews.author: wilma zendel

customer_reviews.title: Not for senior citizens or weak hands
customer_reviews.text: When you're able to maneuver it around, definitely cuts very well. But unless you have very strong hands you will get tired very quickly. Not that easy to place where you want to go and difficult to continue moving forward
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Freedom and convenience
customer_reviews.text: If you really don't want to spend your time in your garden or flowed beds, this is the tool for you. After my back fusion, l can't work down on my knees so this is one of several tools I've found that will let me keep working standing up. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, the head swivels and locks nicely. But after 5 minutes of trimming grass by the edge of the pool deck, the blades went out of alignment, and started chipping into each other. Blades will not go back into alignment, so it's essentially useless. Will buy an old fashioned edge trimmer next.
customer_reviews.author: O J.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive tool is just what I was looking for. A manual grass shears that didn't hurt my hand to maneuver. It's light-weight, has a nice long pole and trimmed the edge of my planter-boxes without any problems. The Weed-Wacker, when it hits a wall or bricks, damages the string that slices through the grass and disables it. This Friskars is perfect for what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Born

customer_reviews.title: You've got to be kidding?!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these remembering the one we had in the family as kid. Probably out there in someones use still. This on the other hand are a shoddy piece of plastic junk. They work poorly and I doubt will make it even half way thru the summer. Why are so many things made so cheaply anymore? Anyone know where to get a REAL pair let me know
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Save your knees & back for something more fun
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect grass clippers , very well made steel construction. The design makes them easy to control standing up. Stainless shears do an effective job of cutting any length grass without using a great deal of hand strength. Would recommend them without reservation to anyone currently hand trimming a small lawn area.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: No hassle light touch up fast trimmer
customer_reviews.text: You need one of these for stubborn weed or grass around objects, trees, bushes etc Well made like all their products. Stores well in garage and has a lot of angles and feature that actually work! Makes my life easier with touch up trimming quickly with no hassle or complicated set up etc.!
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp enough!
customer_reviews.text: I found that pulling the grass along the fence line was faster than cutting with this. Wish I hadn't spent the money on it as it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: E. Navickas

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who hate to stoop over to cut weeds
customer_reviews.text: Being a tall person, I liked having this to avoid breaking my back and knees just to cut a few tall weeds in my yard. The blades aren't that sharp, but do the job nonetheless. It stores easily and is lightweight enough for one handed cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine O

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to start learning how to weed eat and edge but within six weeks of very careful and limited use (once per week), it is already not working. I followed the requirements for the warranty repair and it has been three weeks and they have yet to do anything about it (they will probably blame this on COVID-19 but it was all done via email). Very cheaply made product and even worse customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars tools are great but this one didn't work out for me I was cutting and the tool broke and I'm unable to use it now.
customer_reviews.author: ReyRey

customer_reviews.title: Swivel grass shears
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the old stationary hand grass shears. Not only do you get the extended length so you don’t have to bend down, but the shears swivel, making it easier to get into those hard to reach spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, can be useful but probably not worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: The swivel action works fine. It is lighter grade than I thought it would be, some of the things it was trouble cutting through I can do with a good pair of scissors. The blades do not seem sharp, and There is a gap between the blades which probably affects the way it cuts, but I don’t know if mine is defective or if that is par for the course. The handle is uncomfortable, and paired with the difficulty the blades have with cutting become painful rather quickly. Probably wasn’t worth it.
customer_reviews.author: cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I am over 75 years old and could only trim for about 15 minutes with my regular clippers. With the longer handle I can now stand straight and work for almost an hour at a time without tiring. It is very light weight and easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: D. H.

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver
customer_reviews.text: No more getting down on my hands and knees to cut grass that the mower can't reach. I use this to cut grass around my mailbox post, the street lamp post on my property, the big metal box the electric company uses to feed me from its underground cable, the post the cable company uses as my feed point and anywhere else that grass needs cutting which the mower can't handle. These shears are lightweight, are easy to use, cut the grass cleanly and, best of all, they let me stand up while using them. They do not require a battery, power cord, string or anything else besides a hand. Very handy, very useful and very good.
customer_reviews.author: Duffer.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are into cutting one grass at a time - this item (Fiskars 36 Inch Long-Handle Swivel Grass Shears (92107935J), Black/Orange) is pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ferngully

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Quality is good but Not very easy and relax to use. Only suitable for edge cut or small area fix.
customer_reviews.author: Thea

product_meta.title: Fiskars 36 Inch Long-Handle Swivel Grass Shears (92107935J), Black/Orange
product_meta.description:
The innovative design of our grass shears makes trimming your ornamental grasses easier than ever. A long shaft completely eliminates kneeling and bending, so you can get the job done without sore knees or an aching back. The blades swivel for convenience, and a smooth-cutting mechanism makes every snip virtually effortless. The fully hardened, precision-ground steel blades stay sharp and hold the grass up for clean cuts, the ergonomically designed handle offers comfortable use, and the lightweight aluminum shaft provides lasting durability.

AMAZON.COM
The Fiskars long handle swivel grass shears eliminates the bending and stooping that is required with conventional grass shears. Ideal for hard to reach trimming needs, the unit is 37-inches long, and lightweight for ease of use. The unit's head can rotate 180-degrees, allowing you to easily find an ideal trimming angle, and the precision-ground carbon steel 5-inch blades provide a clean and precise cut. The blades can also lock closed for easy and safe storage.
feature_bullets: Ideal for edging and trimming decorative grasses around flower beds, trees and sidewalks
Long shaft eliminates sore knees from kneeling and back ache from bending
Blades swivel 360 degrees for easy trimming at any angle
4-1/2 inch blades hold grass up for clean cuts and cut all the way to the tip

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,077 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
